com.example.stanza

Class SignupActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.stanza.SignupActivity

  • public class SignupActivity
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to allow a user to create an account for the Stanza app.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void invalidAccount()
      Called if the account information is invalid.
      void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Upon creation of the activity, all view fields (for username, email, and password) are initiated and onClickListeners for the signup button and login link are set up.

      void onFriendSuccess(java.lang.String name)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Upon creation of the activity, all view fields (for username, email, and password) are initiated and onClickListeners for the signup button and login link are set up. An instance of AccountCommThread is initiated for communication with the backend.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - a reference to a Bundle object passed into the Activity

      • onRestart

        public void onRestart()
        Upon restarting the activity, an instance of AccountCommThread will be initialized.

      • signup

        public void signup()
        Called when the signup button is pressed. First checks if the account information is valid. If it is, then an AccountCommThread is initiated to check whether the account information is already being used. If it is not, then the account information will be saved to the backend.

      • invalidAccount

        public void invalidAccount()
        Called if the account information is invalid. Displays a message to the user to this effect.

      • validate

        public boolean validate()
        Ensure that the information (username, email, and password) are all valid entries. Specifically, that the username and password meet the minimum/maximum character requirements and that the email is actually an email. Set an error message if any of these conditions are not satisfied
        Returns:
        True/false depending on whether the account information entered is valid.

      • onServerDisconnected

        public void onServerDisconnected()
        Called from an instance of AccountCommThread if connection to the backend is unsuccessful.

      • onSignupSuccess

        public void onSignupSuccess()
        Called from an instance of AccountCommThread if sign-up is sucessful. Upon success, the user will be logged into the app, and his/her account information would have been stored in the accounts table in the backend.

      • onSignupFailed

        public void onSignupFailed(java.lang.String error_message)
        Called from an instance of AccountCommThread if sign-up fails. This will occur if either the username or email are already used and stored in the accounts table in the backend.
        Parameters:
        error_message - A message describing what the sign-up error was

      • onLoginSuccess

        public void onLoginSuccess()

      • onLoginFailed

        public void onLoginFailed(java.lang.String error_message)

      • onFriendSuccess

        public void onFriendSuccess(java.lang.String name)

      • onFriendFailure

        public void onFriendFailure(java.lang.String error_message)
